content.question: A particle moves along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis so that at time <math alttext="t is greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> its position is given by <math alttext="x of t, equals, 2 times t cubed, minus 9 times t squared, minus 60 t, plus 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mn>9</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>60</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the total distance traveled by the particle over the time interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to t, which is less than or equal to 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
